trans-unit.note: The unit used on distance calculations throughout the system. Default value: 'mi' Valid distance units are: 'km' and 'mi'

The date format used throughout the system Default value: 'm/d/Y' The following characters must be used on the construction of the date format: d => 2 digit numeric representation of the month day, m => 2 digit representation of the month, Y => Year 4 digit numeric representation. Must be UPPERCASE (Y). Lowercase (y) characters will cause errors
The character which separates the decimal part of a number. Default value: '.' Example: 12.34
The character which separates the thousand parts of a number. Default value: ',' Example: 123,456,789.01
The monetary format to be used sitewise Default value: '{symbol} {value}' Example: $ 123.45

The date format used throughout the system Default value: 'h:i a' The following characters must be used on the construction of the date format: h => 12-hour format of an hour with leading zeros (01 through 12) H => 24-hour format of an hour with leading zeros (00 through 23) i => Minutes with leading zeros (00 to 59) s => Seconds, with leading zeros (00 through 59) a => Lowercase Ante meridiem and Post meridiem (am or pm)
